column4: opinions welcome: do you guys think a Ubuntu boot disk will have any more luck than an XP boot disk with a HDD problem that's throwing blue screens of death?
Neither one should be related to HDD problems
What problems are you having booting an XP disc?
well, i've got this vaio that's got no boot screen and it hangs after the XP disk tries to run its installation program
i get the feeling there might be more wrong than the HDD, but i'm willing to test a couple of avenues first.
At what point does it hang? Before it even loads the install part, or while the installation is running?
it gets most of its drivers set up
and then it stops with an error screen
claims i should run chkdsk on the hdd
let's see...should be in my search history...
Yeah, that sounds like a hardware issue
it's a stop code: "stop 0x0000007b"
Yeah. See if the Ubuntu CD gets anywhere
okay. i hope it works. it's this used/refurbish my dad picked up...so, i'm crossing all my fingers, lol

If it doesn't work, then try a new HDD. If that doesn't work, then it's the mobo, and that's generally more expensive than just selling off the working parts of the laptop and buying a newly refurbished one.
okay. that's good to know
i'm just avoiding the HDD replacement...because it's going to be a pain cracking that case
but there's 4 good gigs of laptop RAM i could salvage :D
Usually the HDD is 1-4 screws away... Is sony THAT bad at making things?
well, there's no obvious access
like my toshiba has two panels that you just open one screw for the primary/secondary hdd
